title: Climate Change in Timor-Leste: An Overview
content:
Timor-Leste, a small island nation in Southeast Asia, faces significant climate change challenges:

  • Rising temperatures
  • Changing precipitation patterns
  • Sea-level rise
  • Increased frequency of extreme weather events

visualization.description: Interactive map of Timor-Leste showing key geographical features and climate zones

vocabulary.definition: Long-term alteration in global weather patterns
Rain, snow, sleet, or hail that falls to the ground

title: Temperature Projections
content:
By the 2090s:

  • RCP8.5 scenario: Increase of approximately 2.9°C
  • RCP2.6 scenario: Increase of 0.9°C

visualization.description: Line graph showing projected temperature increases under different RCP scenarios

vocabulary.definition: Representative Concentration Pathway, a greenhouse gas concentration trajectory adopted by the IPCC

title: Precipitation Changes
content:
While overall precipitation changes are uncertain, Timor-Leste is likely to experience:

  • Increased frequency of extreme rainfall events
  • Potential for longer dry periods

visualization.description: Bar chart comparing historical and projected extreme rainfall events

vocabulary.definition: Precipitation that is significantly higher than average

title: Sea-Level Rise
content:
Projections for Timor-Leste:

  • By 2030: 80-180 mm rise
  • By 2090 (RCP8.5): 430-880 mm rise

Impacts include increased coastal flooding and erosion.

visualization.description: Interactive coastal map showing potential inundation under different sea-level rise scenarios

vocabulary.definition: Increase in the level of the world's oceans due to climate change

title: Impacts on Agriculture
content:
Climate change threats to agriculture:

  • Decreased crop yields
  • Shifts in suitable growing areas
  • Increased pest and disease pressure

66% of families rely on farming for livelihoods.

visualization.description: Pie chart showing agricultural dependence in Timor-Leste's economy

vocabulary.definition: The amount of crop produced per unit of land area

title: Water Resources
content:
Climate change impacts on water resources:

  • Increased variability in rainfall
  • Pressure on groundwater resources
  • Higher risk of both floods and droughts

visualization.description: Schematic diagram of Timor-Leste's water cycle and potential climate change impacts

vocabulary.definition: Water held underground in soil or in pores and crevices in rock

title: Biodiversity Risks
content:
Threats to Timor-Leste's biodiversity:

  • Habitat shifts and potential species loss
  • Coral reef degradation due to ocean acidification
  • Mangrove risks from sea-level rise

visualization.description: Interactive ecosystem map showing vulnerable species and habitats

vocabulary.definition: Variety of plant and animal life in a particular habitat
Reduction in the pH of the ocean over an extended period, primarily due to uptake of CO2 from the atmosphere

title: Human Health Impacts
content:
Climate change health risks:

  • Increased heat-related illnesses
  • Spread of vector-borne diseases like malaria and dengue
  • Potential for increased malnutrition

visualization.description: Stacked bar chart showing projected increases in various health risks

vocabulary.definition: Illnesses caused by parasites, viruses, and bacteria transmitted by mosquitoes, ticks, and other vectors

title: Adaptation Strategies
content:
Key adaptation priorities for Timor-Leste:

  • Strengthening climate-resilient agriculture
  • Improving water management
  • Protecting coastal areas
  • Enhancing disaster preparedness
  • Building adaptive capacity

visualization.description: Interactive flowchart of adaptation strategies and their interconnections

vocabulary.definition: Adjustment in natural or human systems in response to actual or expected climatic stimuli or their effects
Capacity of a system to absorb disturbance and reorganize while undergoing change
